Build 20020402
I pulled down the debug history and selected an old launch (runtime workbench
launch). The following NPE occurred.

I believe the problem here is that I had a host with the J9 launching plugin and
created a launch config for that VM type (J9).

When I updated my host, I forgot to put the J9 launching plugin back. This NPE
occurred when I tried to launch a config with J9 set as the VM.

Users should be able to add and remove plugins without blowing up. We need to
handle this.

I found the following in my log:
Log: Wed Apr 03 09:30:27 CST 2002

Re-assigning to PDE team since NPE happens in their code.

I agree that NPE is not acceptable in any case. But you understand that there 
is a problem with saved information here: we persisted launch config (including 
the VM to use) and then you removed the VM out of the system. We should not 
allow you to launch then, but of course not with an NPE :-).
Changing priority to regular - this is not a blocker.
Fixed - PDE will report when stored JRE is missing and abort launching.

Note that the problem here wasn't a missing JRE. The JRE was still installed on
my system. The problem was that the plugin necessary to launch the JRE
(org.eclipse.jdt.launching.j9) was missing.

I understand. What made PDE to bomb was when it tried to locate IVMInstall 
instance using the name stored in the configuration. Since none of the VMs 
matched, it tried to access a null IVMInstall and caused a NPE. The fix was to 
show an error message and abort the launch.
